summary: GAME OF THRONES AESTHETICS: House Stark Let me tell you something about wolves, child. When the snows fall and the white winds...
caption:
GAME OF THRONES AESTHETICS:

House Stark

Let me tell you something about wolves, child. When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies, but the pack survives. Summer is the time for squabbles. In winter, we must protect one another, keep each other warm, share our strengths. 

arya

summary: Can we all please acknowledge that Jon would have died in the Battle of the Bastards if Sansa didn't bring in the Vale? Can we...
body: Can we all please acknowledge that Jon would have died in the Battle of the Bastards if Sansa didn’t bring in the Vale? Can we also acknowledge that SANSA, the oldest child of Eddard and Catelyn Stark, is the heir to Winterfell, not Ned’s bastard?(meaning the people of the North literally disregarded and disrespected Sansa’s claim, despite knowing good and well she was married to Ramsey against her will and kept hostage) AND can we please acknowledge that Arya was so completely out of line to question Sansa’s loyalty, especially when she could have killed Tywin at any time, but chose NOT to, for her own safety? k, thx.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

blog.name: silkygoldmilkweed
blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

summary:
The girls were both witnesses to the slaughter of their family, and the Hound was with them both times. 
Sansa watched the...
body:
The girls were both witnesses to the slaughter of their family, and the Hound was with them both times.

Sansa watched the beheading of Ned Stark (Yoren wouldn’t let Arya look although she was in the crowd, too) and the Hound was there on the platform.

Arya saw how they defiled Robb and Grey Wind, and the Hound carried her away to safety.

title: 6SS: SanSan: Announcement
body:
“But, my Lady you cannot be serious! That man is…”

“Enough,” Sansa rose from her chair, chin up and proud, “That man as you call him, is the only one I would have as husband, the only one I trust to be honest with me, the one I know has no desire to take Winterfell away from me, who is willing to take the Stark name and does not complain that our children will not bear his.”

“But… Clegane of all people? Surely my Lady, there are sons of the North who would do, even in the Riverlands or the Vale instead of him.”

Sansa glared, “And all those noble sons of the North forgot me; you all might as well have given me for dead when I was dragged to a sept to wed Tyrion Lannister, and you cannot deny it, my own brother disinherited me and the only reason why I hold Winterfell now, is because of my siblings support.”

Silence and some shame greeted her statement, “So yes, I will marry Sandor Clegane and he will be Sandor Stark, my brothers and sister approve, all I did is give you all a courtsey warning.”

Once the men had left, Arya spoke, “You know, didn’t think you’d had it in you - well done.”

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

tags: The best relationship in this series
summary:
Needle was Jon Snow’s smile.  
The memory of her laughter warmed him on the long ride north. 

  
She found herself wishing that...
body:
Needle was Jon Snow’s smile.

The memory of her laughter warmed him on the long ride north.

She found herself wishing that Jon was here with her now. Then maybe she wouldn’t feel so alone. 

She yearned to see her mother again, and Robb and Bran and Rickon…but it was Jon Snow she thought of most. She wished somehow they could come to the Wall before Winterfell, so Jon might muss up her hair and call her “little sister.” She’d tell him, “I missed you,” and he’d say it too at the very same moment, the way they always used to say things together. She would have liked that. She would have liked that better than anything.

He missed his true brothers: […] Robb, his rival and best friend and constant companion. […] And Arya … he missed her even more than Robb, skinny little thing that she was, all scraped knees and tangled hair and torn clothes, so fierce and willful. Arya never seemed to fit, no more than he had … yet she could always make Jon smile. He would give anything to be with her now, to muss up her hair once more and watch her make a face, to hear her finish a sentence with him.

Maybe I should go to the Wall instead of Riverrun. Jon wouldn’t care who I killed or whether I brushed my hair

Her home was gone, her parents dead, and all her brothers slain but Jon Snow on the Wall. That was where she had wanted to go.

Arya stared at [the children] with resentment, remembering the times she’d played at hoops with Bran and Jon and their baby brother Rickon. […] She would have given anything if Jon had been here to call her “little sister” and muss her hair.

[Jon] remembered suddenly how he used to muss Arya’s hair. His little stick of a sister. He wondered how she was faring. It made him a little sad to think that he might never muss her hair again.

Alone, [Arya] slid through the shadow of the Tower of Ghosts. She walked fast, to keep ahead of her fear, and it felt as though Syrio Forel walked beside her, and Yoren, and Jaqen H’ghar, and Jon Snow.

Arya missed Jon most of all. Just saying his name made her sad.

She wondered if [Jon] would still call her “little sister.” I’m not so little anymore. He’d have to call me something else.

[…] She missed Jon Snow the most of all her brothers.

She had never cared if she was pretty, even when she was stupid Arya Stark. Only her father had ever called her that. Him, and Jon Snow, sometimes. 

What do you know of my heart, priestess? What do you know of my sister?

Jon Snow sank to one knee in the snow. Gods of my fathers, protect these men. And Arya too, my little sister, wherever she might be. I pray you, let Mance find her and bring her safe to me.

Bring her home, Mance. I saved your son from Melisandre, and now I am about to save four thousand of your free folk. You owe me this one little girl.

The girl smiled in a way that reminded Jon so much of his little sister that it almost broke his heart.

This is just a quarter of all the times Jon and Arya spend time thinking of each other over 5 books. There’s a reason for why Jon and Arya have the best relationship in ASoIaF - just pure, unconditional love.

It completely baffles me that, after reading the books, there are still people who think that the next season of GOT is going to be all about Jon and Sansa’s great romantic repressed love. Like really? When the show has saved the best reunion for last? When the books have been leading to this moment from the very beginning? When Jon and Arya are going to be in the same place again after 23 years, 5 books and 7 seasons?

Suddenly [Arya] looked like she was going to cry. “I wish you were coming with us.”

“Different roads sometimes lead to the same castle. Who knows?” He was feeling better now. He was not going to let himself be sad.

tags: A storm of swords really drove this point
Sansa’s Lady persona is her veil to spy on stuff
much like Arya’s No One even before she went to Braavos
another thing i hope the tv show had done better
and why I didn’t like how they cut Sansa’s Alayne storyline
there’s a reason she is also called little bird
summary: I have a rough, incomplete essay about how “Lady” is Sansa’s agency to survive the game of thrones equivalent to that of Arya’s...
body:
I have a rough, incomplete essay about how “Lady” is Sansa’s agency to survive the game of thrones equivalent to that of Arya’s “No One” to both show how similar these two are, and to highlight Sansa’s intelligence as opposed to what her haters claim her to be.

I may not also complete it.

summary: “Who are you?” he would ask her every day. “No one,” she would answer, she who had been Arya of House Stark, Arya Underfoot,...
caption: “Who are you?” he would ask her every day. “No one,” she would answer, she who had been Arya of House Stark, Arya Underfoot, Arya Horseface. She had been Arry and Weasel too, and Squab and Salty, Nan the cupbearer, a grey mouse, a sheep, the ghost of Harrenhal… but not for true, not in her heart of hearts. In there she was Arya of Winterfell.

reblog.comment: “Who are you?” he would ask her every day. “No one,” she would answer, she who had been Arya of House Stark, Arya Underfoot, Arya Horseface. She had been Arry and Weasel too, and Squab and Salty, Nan the cupbearer, a grey mouse, a sheep, the ghost of Harrenhal… but not for true, not in her heart of hearts. In there she was Arya of Winterfell.

She had been Arry and Weasel too, and Squab and Salty, Nan the cupbearer, a grey mouse, a sheep, the ghost of Harrenhal… but not for true, not in her heart of hearts. In there she was Arya of Winterfell.

She had been Arry and Weasel too, and Squab and Salty, Nan the cupbearer, a grey mouse, a sheep, the ghost of Harrenhal… but not for true, not in her heart of hearts. In there she was Arya of Winterfell.

summary: I've read a few posts that Sansa's behavior towards Arya was acceptable because she didn't meet Sansa's standards on what a...
body:
I’ve read a few posts that Sansa’s behavior towards Arya was acceptable because she didn’t meet Sansa’s standards on what a sister should be. Like WTF? Seriously? Do these people not realize how ridiculous that sounds? Basically- it’s ok to bully someone if they aren’t who you want them to be. God forbid that Arya is her own person, she should have just done everything she could to make Sansa happy.

And there’s some crazy notion that Arya’s non-conformity to being a lady was somehow accepted and celebrated while Sansa was considered an outsider and alone in the books. Where the hell do people get that idea? It was drilled in Arya’s head that she was found lacking and her sister was a perfect example of what a lady should be. And Sansa knew that. She and her friends ridiculed Arya over it. That’s why even after she knows her sister is missing and possibly dead, she still thinks Arya was unsatisfactory as a sister because she wasn’t what Sansa wanted in a sister.

I get having a favorite character and want to overlook things that may cast them in a bad light but some people go too far. It’s ridiculous at this point.

summary: I just remembered that Sansa is the only Stark kid who has witnessed Ned’s beheading (Yoren protected Arya from that sight) and...
body:
I just remembered that Sansa is the only Stark kid who has witnessed Ned’s beheading (Yoren protected Arya from that sight) and Arya is the only one of her siblings who has watched the Frey parading Robb’s dead and abused body.

These poor girls have been through a lot. They deserve a break.

reblog.comment:
I just remembered that Sansa is the only Stark kid who has witnessed Ned’s beheading (Yoren protected Arya from that sight) and Arya is the only one of her siblings who has watched the Frey parading Robb’s dead and abused body.

These poor girls have been through a lot. They deserve a break.

title: 6SS: Arya & Sansa: Weirdo
body:
“What the hell is going on?” Arya stood at the door of her sister’s bedroom, wide eyed looking around, Sansa was sitting crossed legged in her bed, candles had been lit, some music she didn’t understood was playing and there were crystals all over the place.

Sansa opened one eye, “Fix your aura before you get in, I will not accept any sort of negativity in my room today.”

“Uh… ok, listen, just wanted you to know that I’m going with some friends to the movies, want me to bring dinner after?”

“Sure, whatever you want, thank you Arya.”

“Bye,” then whispered, “weirdo.”

From behind the door, Sansa’s voice called out, “I heard that!”
